Job Summary
The AV Support Analyst provides technical advice and support for a variety of audio visual equipment and services. The AV Support Analyst has a core focus on the testing, configuration, commissioning, and deficiency/bug management of complex AV systems and AV equipment, as well as tier 2 support for escalated AV and AV network related systems issues that cannot be resolved by the AV Technician team. This position also manages business intelligence, asset tracking, and system documentation of specialized AV equipment and AV related IT systems, such as classroom computers, video conference hardware, media capture and live streaming systems. This position also demonstrates the operation of this equipment to any users as required.
This position is a middle level AV implementation and integration resource, and will be responsible for the successful completion of advanced testing and quality control activities, with minimal direct supervision or support.
The AV Support & Commissioning Analyst will also manage other AV functions as required, such as AV system support and training, system documentation, system and product remove & replace for repair, room scheduling and bookings, hand over processes, user/client satisfaction reviews, and asset management.
This position works a fixed schedule but requires flexibility as some work must be performed outside of regular business operating hours.
